name: Astir of Naxos

reviews.title: 4th year in Naxos our faverate greek Island
reviews.text: The Astir of Naxos is a beautiful hotel the owner Mr Margaritis is a perfect host he makes you feel welcome and nothing is to much trouble for his guests, all rooms are spotles and cleaned every day with clean towles and sheets. The swimming pool is allso cleaned every day and is a plesure to swim in the brakfast has a wide variaty of hot english and continental foods with lots of freash fruits some have been grown in the lovely hotel garden this for us makes the Astir a perfect place to stay for our 3 week holiday in July-August on the lovely Island of Naxos. we have been visiting the greek Islands for 25 years now and this is our faverate Island and hotel to stay if you love relaxing you cannot get any better 2008 will be our 5th year on Naxos and 4th year in the Astir. Robert and Lindsey South Yorkshire UK

The Astir of Naxos is a clean, quiet, and new hotel on the edge of town but within walking distance of Chora. We found the distance of 20-30 minutes walk to be a bonus. You may find the hotel lacks a bit in charm because of its newness. There is a grocery store very near by where you can buy wine and honey cheaper than in the tourist areas. The pool is beautiful and its hours of operation are somewhat limited as a courtesy to the guests who sleep late or go to bed early. I believe most rooms have a view of the pool as well as a balcony. There is also a fridge but it was so well hidden we didn’t find it until the last day. The breakfast is above average (all the hotels in Greece overcook the scrambled eggs, undercook the bacon, and the orange juice is really orange drink). Marusha (sp?) was a most helpful front desk person and recommended some great restaurants. Mr. Margaritas is also very friendly and seems genuinely interested in his guests.
reviews.title: Clean, quiet, and just a walk away from Naxos Town

reviews.text: TIPS – DO rent a car and drive all over this amazing island. In just a few minutes you’re out in the countryside with goat herding locals and ancient Byzantine churches sprinkled about. Buy a woven textile from the “weaver woman” in Halki and stop for coffee and ice cream in the mountain village of Filoti.
reviews.title: Great distinction

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: DO go horseback riding with the very serious, professional but still fun Iris Neubauer. Our boys (13 and 9) loved it as did we. We saw parts of the island you would otherwise miss.
reviews.title: Back again - 3rd time

reviews.text: DON’T bother eating at Nicko’s as suggested in the Frommer’s guidebook. The food was less than mediocre and the service was terrible. There are so many great restaurants in Naxos Town, why waste any time on this one!
reviews.title: Good value,quiet hotel near the beach

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel was an absolute treasure. The hotel was clean and quiet with a very nice pool. The staff were great and were very helpful in ensuring that we had the best vacation we could have! I would recommend this hotel to anyone travelling to Naxos!
reviews.title: Great Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We thoroughly enjoyed our stay at the Astir Hotel it is situated at the far end of St. Georges beach in a verty quiet location which although quiet is not remote. There are bars and restaurant nearby. I would certainly reccommend the Flisvos beach bar to sip a cocktail and watch the sunset.
reviews.title: A lovely Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Hotel is maintained to a very high standard with a lovely garden and a beautiful large pool which is kept in pristine condition. The variety of breakfast provided each day should suit even the most demanding visitor with fresh fruit and produce from the garden readily available.The rooms are kept in immaculate condition with room and pool towels changed daily more so if required.
reviews.title: Friendly, clean and a very pleasant way to start the holiday

reviews.text: A twenty minute walk along the beach takes you into Naxos town itself which has a huge variety of bars and restaurants. Behind the main town is a beautiful labyrinth of little alleys with a vast array of quirky shops, old restaurants etc... well worth exploring
reviews.title: Excellent value for money

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Naxos is a lovely island with beautiful beaches and great scenery it is well worth hiring a car for a day to explore inland as there are some lovely little villages.
reviews.title: Thoroughly Good Stay

reviews.text: I stayed for 17 nights, and made many observations. First it is "personally cared for", the owner is an older gentlemen [I think name is Michael Margaritas??], and is present every day directing the employees. It is the little things that in themselves you do not usually notice, but add up to create an overall impression. The grounds are well manicured, vegetable gardens on one side, a small grape vineyard on the other, flower and cactus plantings all around. The choice in pool furniture, nice lounge chairs, clean and beautiful pool and pool deck, public areas clean. I observed many times the owner out directing the staff in the early morning "why is this ash-tray not emptied", "why is this corner of the pool deck not swept clean?" Trust me, this personal attention makes all the difference compared to corporate/commercial hotel or hotel with passive owner. It is his baby, his pride and joy!
reviews.title: Excellent, Clean, Friendly, Perfect

reviews.text: The rooms are clean, no stains on walls or ceilings from dead bugs, no mold growing in corners of shower, slept in comfortable clean sheets. The beds are hard (no box spring mattress- just wooden slat under mattress) but I liked the bed firm, it was good. I suspect the room is about as good as it gets for being "on Island", tiled floors, small LCD TV, mini-refrigerator which is key for storing fruits and drinks from very nearby grocery store. It is not a "5 star city furnished" room with marble top bathroom vanities- but you will not find that anywhere in Naxos; but all amenities and fixtures were clean and appropriate. Air Conditioner worked fine, but much of the time I left the veranda doors wide open for nice breeze- bugs were not any issue, and safety is not issue (I left my door unlocked most times when going to pool, left my laptop on the desk with just small laptop lock to chair- but all without concern). Clientele is mix of Greek and Euro persons on vacation- families, older couples, families with mid-teen aged children, families with infants. Just guessing that there are only about 30 rooms, so easy to meet and have conversation with other guests at personal level.
reviews.title: Perfect Stay
Beautiful hotel, quiet location
reviews.text: Internet access in room was by LAN cable, and internet speed was decent. Had wireless in pool and lobby areas, and in many rooms I am sure had this wireless access (including my room) but I used the LAN cable.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Breakfast is at 8:00 AM (until whenever); coffee available by 7:30 AM, always had fried eggs, scrambled eggs with vegetables, sausage and bacon, fruits, breads, cereals- was nice breakfast.
reviews.title: Nice spot on Naxos, great breakfast

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Staff was very helpful, the front desk woman who worked days and the also the front desk woman who worked evenings- very personable and helpful- calling for taxis, recommending restaurants, pointing out places of interest, and just plain friendly and hospitable.
reviews.title: Nice pool, clean, very hard beds!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Very nice hotel, very clean, lovely pool!
reviews.title: Very nice!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Breakfast is ok, seen better at other hotels in the Cyclades.
reviews.title: The best hotel we stayed in

reviews.text: About 3 minute walk to Agios Georgios beach and 15 minute walk to waterfront in Naxos Town, so it's convenient, no need to take the bus to go to town. The street-road to come back at night may seem a little scary at first but never had any problem and felt safe.
reviews.title: The Astir is a lovely hotel

likes.disliked: — not enough hanging out to dry space for wet towels etc..

aka: Astir Of Naxos Hotel Naxos City
